summary: This document is a sealed application and order from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking to unseal discovery materials from a settled civil defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell. The materials are held by the law firm Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP and are sought for a secret federal grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and others for sex trafficking of minors. The application was granted by Judge Robert W. Sweet.

persons.name: Alex Rossmiller
persons.context: The prosecutor who filed the application to unseal civil discovery materials for use in the federal grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and others.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney whose office is conducting the investigation; Alex Rossmiller is an AUSA in his office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the underlying civil defamation lawsuit (15 Civ. 7433). The grand jury investigation is into her and Jeffrey Epstein for possible sex trafficking violations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a perpetrator of sex crimes, along with Ghislaine Maxwell, in the underlying civil case. The subject of the ongoing federal grand jury investigation for sex trafficking.

persons.name: Robert W. Sweet
persons.context: The judge who issued the protective order in the civil case and later granted the government's application to unseal discovery materials for the grand jury.

connections.description: Described together as perpetrators of sex crimes in the underlying civil lawsuit, and both are subjects of the federal grand jury investigation.
Rossmiller is an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the office of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.
Judge Sweet presided over the civil case against Maxwell and issued the protective order governing its discovery materials.

events.title: Civil Defamation Lawsuit Filed
events.description: An unnamed plaintiff filed a civil action against Ghislaine Maxwell, alleging she made defamatory statements denying the plaintiff was a victim of sex crimes perpetrated by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: Judge Robert W. Sweet issued a protective order in the civil case (15 Civ. 7433) restricting disclosure of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Civil Case Settled
events.description: The parties entered into a settlement agreement and voluntarily dismissed the civil defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Government Seeks to Unseal Discovery
events.description: AUSA Alex Rossmiller files a sealed application to obtain discovery materials from the settled civil case for a federal grand jury investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Court Orders Release of Materials
events.description: Judge Robert W. Sweet grants the government's application, ordering Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP to provide the confidential discovery materials to the government for the grand jury investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was conducting a secret federal grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell for sex trafficking of minors as of February 2019.
The government sought discovery materials from a settled 2015 civil defamation lawsuit against Maxwell, believing they contained information relevant to the criminal investigation.
The civil lawsuit alleged Maxwell made defamatory statements denying the plaintiff was a victim of sex crimes perpetrated by Epstein and Maxwell.
A protective order from 2016 initially prevented the law firm Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP from complying with a grand jury subpoena for the materials.
Judge Robert W. Sweet granted the government's ex parte application, allowing the materials to be turned over to the grand jury while keeping the investigation's existence sealed from the public.
